meanings.definition: To convert (an atom, molecule, or substance) into an ion.
meanings.sent1: The experiment showed how the machine was ionizing the gas.
meanings.sent2: She carefully studied the process of ionizing different elements.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous scientist accidentally turned the entire lab into an ionizing zone!
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to ionize the atmosphere, creating a charged tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's power was to ionize objects with a single touch.

meanings.definition: Capable of producing ions, as radiation.
meanings.sent1: The ionizing radiation emitted from the sun can be harmful if not protected against.
meanings.sent2: Scientists wear special gear to shield themselves from ionizing particles during experiments.
meanings.sent3: The ionizing properties of the crystal made it glow in the dark, much to the amusement of the researchers.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like ionizing energy, spreading positivity wherever she went.
meanings.sent5: The ionizing effect of the storm was evident in the charged air and crackling sounds.
